meanings.definition: Feel or express great loathing for
meanings.sent1: She execrates the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent2: He execrates the idea of waking up early.
meanings.sent3: The cat execrates the sight of cucumbers on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His heart execrates the thought of betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs execrates her senses.

meanings.sent1: They execrate the sound of nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent2: She execrates the feeling of wet socks.
meanings.sent3: The toddler execrates the taste of vegetables with a passion.
meanings.sent4: His mind execrates the idea of giving up on his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The old man execrates the thought of growing weak with age.
